alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 16 at 10:31PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MDT/8 AM CDT/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Colorado and Kansas, including the following counties, in east central Colorado, Cheyenne and Kit Carson. In Kansas, Gove, Graham, Greeley, Logan, Sheridan, Sherman, Thomas, Wallace and Wichita. * WHEN...Until 7 AM MDT/8 AM CDT/ Saturday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Torrential rainfall associated with widespread thunderstorms may rapidly lead to flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
